If the patch for HER-1812 (https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1812) wer=
e accepted, then it would be possible to disable specific reports entirely.=
 It would also be easy to augment individual reports to make their behavior=

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordo=
n Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> There's no existing configuration option to =
disable end-of-crawl 
> reports. The StatisticsTracker assumes you want rep=
orts (see how its 
> crawlEnded() method calls dumpReports()), and it's gen=
erally assumed a 
> StatisticsTracker will be present.
> 
> However, since =
that's handled by the public method 
> StatisticsTracker.dumpReports(), sim=
ply creating your own subclass of 
> StatisticsTracker that doesn't do anyt=
hing there should do the trick.
> 
> And further, a feature of the Spring c=
onfiguration framework we're using 
> is that you can even create new class=
es *in your configuration file(s)* 
> -- sparing you the need to add an Jav=
a classes to your build. See:
> 
> http://static.springsource.org/spring/do=
cs/2.5.x/reference/dynamic-language.html#dynamic-language-beans
> 
> So it =
shouldn't be hard to suppress reports in your crawls. We'd also 
> welcome =
a patch that makes whether all reports are dumped, or the list 
> of report=
s available or auto-dumped, crawl operator configurable through 
> toggles =
or a named list.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>
